sub_title: Open to work | Data Reporting Analyst | Project Management Assistant | Back Office | Office Manager
summary:
I am an experienced operations professional with a demonstrated history in the oil & gas industry. I have strong skills in Management Support, Planning and Budgetting (used SAP system), Management Information, Mid Office (interface between commercial/contracting and finance), Learning (I have been Learning Advisor Road Safety, involved in course programming/management and creation of e-learnings) and Safety (both as a reporting specialist (provided management dashboards/reports) and a learning from incidents analyst). In the Learning and Safety roles I have worked with/in Shell dedicated systems.

In my work I am focussed, driven and results oriented. I am well developed in creating simple, compelling and fit-for-purpose messages for a variety of audiences (safety alerts, processes, procedures, guidelines, instructions). I am reliable and accountable. analytical and a problem solver, pro-active and persistent when needed. I am customer oriented and service-minded; I am a good listener, I give my customers what they need. I am able to see the big picture, but at the same time, have a great eye for detail. I am a self-starter, but even more a ‘finisher’.

profile_positions.description:
Responsibility: Provide timely, informative and quality S&E Management Information / performance reporting to the Upstream Conventional Oil & Gas Line of Business, on a monthly, quarterly and annual basis.
Highlights:
-	Create monthly, quarterly (Critical Review) and annual reports/presentations. 
-	Keep up-to-date own master data spreadsheet with Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)/incident information from ventures not in FIM (Shell Safety System), by obtaining & going through monthly NOV reports.
-	Quality check data in FIM and follow up on issues with country gate keepers. Train new gate keepers on the use of FIM. Be the focal point for country S&E managers and gate keepers.
-	Act upon ad-hoc requests; be involved in ad-hoc projects. 
-	Manage notification process of Significant (RAM4+), High Potential and Tier 1 & 2 Process Safety Incidents (incl. UP/Group ticker tape communications).
-	Coordinate monthly report to update UP LT on all Significant, High Potential and Tier 1 & 2 Process Safety Incidents.
-	Coordinate the annual ‘Data Control and Assurance Plan’ document review for all of Upstream.
-	Act as the UP focal point to Health w.r.t. the review of Occupational Illnesses and Non-Accidental Death incidents.
-	Collect injuries, process safety, high potential and motor vehicle incidents for the EP function in Shell and provide data to IOGP.
profile_positions.title: HSSE Reporting Specialist

profile_positions.description:
Responsibility: Support the Learning from Incidents (LFI) Manager to continuously improve the Learning from Incidents process in HSSE across all Upstream assets.
Highlights:
-	Broad overview of Safety (both personal and process safety), Environment, Health and Security challenges across Upstream business.
-	Lead the creation of fit for purpose and high quality Upstream Learning from Incidents alerts and materials.
-	Coach country/Line of Business LFI coordinators to improve quality of country Learning from Incidents alerts; train/skill build them in use of global LFI data base and processes.
-	Create quarterly and monthly reports on Learning from Incidents (measure penetration of alerts & analysis of repeat incidents), Reflective Learning Themes roll out status to measure impact and steer effectiveness of Learning from Incidents. Coordinate monthly report to update UP LT on all Significant, High Potential and Tier 1 & 2 Process Safety Incidents.
-	Manage notification process of Significant (RAM4+), High Potential and Tier 1 & 2 Process Safety Incidents (incl. UP/Group ticker tape communications).
-	Contribute to Remove the Hazard Reflective Learning Theme and Next Level of Learning Strategy Document (for the latter provide thorough analyses on Significant & High Potential Incidents and LFI alerts).
profile_positions.title: Learning from Incidents Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Responsibility: Manage the (global) road safety related training portfolio and Learning representative/action party in Defensive Driving Training Project Team.
Highlights:
- Ensure the proper running of the annual Road Safety course program, including financial, contractual, organisational and administrative tasks.
- Co-create and design set up of Defensive Driving Training (DDT) program in Shell Open University, aimed to 1. establish rationalisation & accreditation of instructor-led DDT providers and 2. implement a 4 year rolling global DDT Certification Program for staff driving on company business in all countries/businesses that Shell is operating in.
- Contribute to/create many different communications (& documents) and interact with many different staff in many different Shell outfits and externally.
- Lead creation of 8 e-learning courses (5 with external and 3 with internal parties).
profile_positions.title: Learning Advisor HSSE&SP (for Road Safety)

profile_positions.description:
Responsibility: Provide Finance (and Purchase) advice and Management Information to Projects & Technology (P&T) LOE (Learning & Organisational Effectiveness), the Learning outfit through which all P&T training is coordinated.
Highlights:
- Coordinate Yearly Budget and Latest Estimate exercises for 4-6 Faculties. Co-ordinate PT LOE quarterly (KPI) dashboard information pack.
-  Provide (daily) support to Leadership and staff in the PT LOE outfit on financial, Purchasing and related matters. Create process guidance.
profile_positions.title: Coordinator Business Services, Controls, Management Information

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities: Act as interface between Front (Commercial) and Back (Finance) Office, ensuring proper execution of gas related contracts (and providing proper – accrual and invoicing – information to Finance).
Highlights:
- Co-design, develop and implement SEE BV Deal to Cash process.
- Implement Mid Office interim Billing & Accruals tool, a database  in which all contracts and monthly volume- and price data is uploaded to provide accruals and invoicing information to Finance.
- Coordinate monthly accrual and invoicing process. Review monthly End of Chain report (gas in = gas out + gas in storage) with Finance.
profile_positions.title: Mid Office Administrator / Team Lead

company.name: Shell International Exploration and Production B.V.

profile_positions.company: Shell International Exploration and Production B.V.
profile_positions.description:
Responsibility: Perform accounting, finance and administrative duties for SEAPOS. Support set up of a new company for BC-10 offshore activities (Tamba B.V.).
Highlights:
- Accounting for SEAPOS B.V. in SUN, EPMIS and FIRST (Shell Group finance systems). 
- Assist in establishment of Tamba B.V. (review Articles of Association, open bank account, ensure set up of Tamba in Shell’s financial system). Tamba accounting.
profile_positions.title: Business / Financial Analyst Shell E&P Offshore Services B.V. (SEAPOS)

profile_positions.company: Shell International Exploration and Production B.V.
profile_positions.description:
Responsibility: Provide leadership and guidance to the WRM (Work & Resource Management = project set up) PSN members. 25-30 staff.
Highlights:
- Verify policy and processes related to WRM and communicate and implement policy changes within and outside the PSN network. 
- Organise (PSN) events and (WRM) training sessions. Contribute to PSN/WRM forums, create communications.
- Give suggestions for improvement to the WRM process manager and business process advisor and act as their sounding board.
profile_positions.title: WRM Focal Point Project Support Network (PSN)

profile_positions.company: Shell International Exploration and Production B.V.
profile_positions.description:
Responsibility: Provide leadership to the CMDS team on the NL side and guidance on WRM (Work & Resource Management; i.e. set up projects in SAP).
Highlights:
- Lead daily operations in NL, ensuring customer and team satisfaction. Fine tune operations with USA. Recruit, train, coach team members. 
- Focal point for WRM; coordinate WRM activities for global team; contribute to WRM Process Improvement; review WRM process flows and documentation, participate in SOx walkthrough, set up projects in the SAP.
profile_positions.title: NL Team lead Centralised Master Data Service Team (CMDS)

profile_positions.description:
Responsibility: Provide financial and HR support to the cluster leadership team of the Shared Earth Model (SEM) cluster.
Highlights:
- Prepare for SEM’s yearly operating budget and quarterly Business Reviews; SEM Capital Expenditure focal point; advise staff on project set up / finances; liaise with customers.
- Develop / administer staff related activities (Business Needs Framework, Early Career Review, Stock Options, Progression Panels, Performance Management); quality control personnel data in HR and finance systems; provide quarterly overviews.
- Mentor 8 cluster assistants (in NL and USA).
profile_positions.title: Financial Management Coordinator

profile_positions.description: Responsibility: Provide financial, contracting and general administrative support to contract centre manager and approx 50 to 70 staff.
profile_positions.title: Contract Centre / Cluster Assistant

profile_positions.description: Responsibility: Provide administrative and secretarial (and some financial) support to department manager and approx 50 to 70 staff.
profile_positions.title: Departmental Secretary for various departments

profile_positions.company: Koninklijke Shell Exploratie and Productie Laboratorium
profile_positions.description: Responsibility: Run the Staff Council’s secretariat, by handling daily affairs, organising and minuting all Staff Council meetings, writing publications to all KSEPL staff and the Annual Repor,t and organising elections, hearings and away days.
profile_positions.title: Secretary to Staff Council
